It would be awesome if going into a menu wasn't necessary to post a message
On the topic detail view, it seems that the newer messages are on the top
I'm not sure if you're ready to hear feedback or not.
Oh, cool
Firstly, this app is awesome!  I'm an Android user, so it makes me happy to see it.
I'm noticing a weird bug where people's avatars seem to be wrong, and then they change and turn into the correct avatar.

when clicking a message i wanted to add a dialog, whether you want to answer to that post.
unread counts will be implemented tomorrow, i think
That will be very cool
Wow, I just downloaded the new version...just wow!
It's getting really good really fast.
I don't seem to be able to get live updates to work...I think it was working before, but not anymore.
it appears @sirdiego was able to help you?
I'm on a nexus s runnin 2.3.3
did you try entering the password a second time, just to be sure?
I can't seem to get this to work. I enter my username and password, hit back, it says its validating, then takes me back to the settings screen.
this is from the app. Woot!
ahh. I think I had an extra space after my username.
didn't test on a 2.3.3 emulator yet. installing one now
I did. Entered the password twice. still the same.
Might consider removing spaces before/after username
great news ;)
Nice job, on the app it will be very useful during pycon.
perhaps i should also add "Thanks!"
Great app... thanks.
seems you might want to separate "new message notifications" and "mention notifications" so i could disable one without disabling the other. apologies if this feature has already been requested
@dhgwilliam I did not yet implement mention notifications. But I will keep in mind to add a separate preference once I do

First of all kudos for the app! and second I just wanted to ask a question: is there a way to see conversations beyond the first page? I can only get to the few on the first page and can't seem to find a way to access the others...

@juandg loading more messages is implemented, but not really active/intuitive yet. you have to wait 30s after the initial load and then scroll to the end.

i will add a button to show that more messages are available and get rid of the delay in the next version.
Great stuff! Thanks for working on this for all us Android peeps. When do to plan on releasing it to the market?
Great app and works very well on the original Droid. Thank you.
After doing a little reading on the List of Tested Devices I should have said that I am using 2.2
Really minor point, but it would be useful to have an "About" activity to display the current version. Awesome work so far.
I had to turn of notifications because I was getting multiple icons.   How about one that gives a count of new messages?
@achernow multiple notification icons are intentional. One notification per topic, so you can jump into the topic directly. The new message count (if x > 0) is displayed on the icons, too.
interesting little precioussssesssss

I don't have an android phone new enough to run convorsation, but am getting one soon, and would really like to be able to sign in to convore using my Twitter/Facebook on the android app. I do have a convore password but it would be nice to login the same way I do on the web. If this is already possible then just ignore this suggestion. :P
i'm afraid that isn't possible, as the convore api implements only http-auth

I'm getting a Force Close when trying to create a new topic - a friend is having the same problem. Has anyone else experienced this? Running the latest version (uninstalled and reinstalled apk downloaded today) on 2.2.

@berryp that bug did not trigger in my tests yet. if you know adb and could send me a crashlog that would be much appreciated.
./adb -d logcat | grep -C5 convorsation > convorsation-crash.txt
@EisFrei https://gist.github.com/887146 That's the logcat from selecting new topic, then the FC. If you want more let me know what specifically. Thanks.
@EisFrei and I'm now using the market version (which I suspect is the same as the version I downloaded yesterday anyway.)

By the way, I think the app deserves high ratings in the market - will rate shortly. Bugs are totally expected, especially in a new app - it really annoys me when people down-rate just for the odd bug or FC.

thanks for the log and the praises ;)
you are correct, right now the downloads are identical.
i'll check the log over the weekend and hopefully will get the crash fixed

now i feel stupid. i forgot to add a string to the default language (english).
as my devices display everything in german, i simply didn't notice...
the fixed version will be up soon
@EisFrei easy mistake. The new release fixes the bug - I've successfully added a topic from my phone.
Loving these releases, thanks again @EisFrei :)
Is there a way to stick groups/topics with unread stuff at the top?
not yet. i'll think about adding that
Just tested on a stock Samsung Galaxy S Vibrant none-4G (T-Mobile USA) (2.1-update1 Eclair). Get "connection error" every time it tries to login.

@berryp According to @EisFrei (the author of the app) there are a few things used that are not available in 2.1 - so 2.2 is required for Convorsation to run. (see: https://convore.com/convorsation/list-of-tested-devices/322083/)
Dropbox .apk crashed like hell on Nexus S, but that from market works like a charm.

@skohler  @berryp you can run the market version of convorsation on 2.1
if you can access websites, the connection error is most certainly caused by a missing certificate authority. currently the ca list from the device is used, but i think i will include one in a future version.
Ah, thanks @skohler. I missed that comment when going through the list of tested devices. Probably didn't help that I was trying to view the site on my phone - which goes a bit screwy.
@EisFrei I get the certificate error on the website so that's probably it.
sup
still working on migrating from json-files to sqlite-db. ran into some concurrency problems i want to fix before releasing the next version.
Won't let me log in :o(
Can't use the market version at the moment, so using the apk - maybe that's the problem
are you on 2.1?
some devices dont recognize the certificate authority, because it's not bundled...
Amazing, thanks :o)
Yes, 2.1
just having a friend helping me out with the certificate stuff. hope to get this fixed soon
i think i've fixed that certificate stuff, cross your fingers
it appears to be fixed. at least it's working in the emulator. grab 0.2.0b here: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/5043669/convorsation.apk will upload it to the market in a minute
done
Works! Thankyou!
Yay! It works on my rooted Nook color! Excellent job!
Does not seem to work with my Xoom on 3.0... Cannot login

strange...
did you press enter to confirm username or password? if so, delete the line break.
My bad ! i was using my email to login !
i'll think about it
any chance to change the language in-app? I like my phone menus to be in german, but some apps should still use english.
Works on my new HTC Thunderbolt, though there wasn't much doubt.
@EisFrei a copy url long click option would be really useful. just tried visiting a twitter url but the phone/twitter did some funky redirect and lost the original query.
good idea @berryp i'll definitely add that. might take another week before i release another version as i'm quite busy this week
@EisFrei I think an update every couple weeks is perfectly acceptable. :)
this is great
Recently noticed that the avatars all populate before the topics are refreshed. May just be the async timing, but if it isn't, my preference would be updates to the content.
@justinlilly I'm not sure I understand, can you please elaborate?

When I open a list of groups, all of the avatar faces populate. Presumably those are coming from the network. Some time after that, the content actually refreshes showing my  read/unread counts for each topic. I would prefer to see the unread counts at a higher priority than avatars for topic lists (and actually everything else too)
This is possibly due to a cache, in which case disregard.

@justinlilly you are correct. the convore api is called before loading the images. both the api-call and the image-loading are done in asynctasks. the posts get written to the database before they are displayed (sqlite is slower than i anticipated) which causes this effect.
Are you planning to add a "mark all read" to the client? At the moment it's quicker for me to come to the website.
@Joltrast indeed. it will be added to the context menu of the group list
Sweet! Thanks :o)
Sweet! Thanks :o)

Hello everyone. I found out that Convorsation didn't log me out when I backed out of the app (with the back button ;) instead of using the quit button in the app. Seems that a service is running until the quit button is hit. It would be good to have a permanent notification icon displayed as long as the Convorsation service is running. What do you think?
you are correct. a new notification appears per topic that has a new message. i'm afraid adding another icon would crowd the taskbar too much. i'll give it a thought

@EisFrei well, i would prefer to have one notification, and only one. this notification should show up as long as i'm logged in w/ convorsation. as soon as there are new messages, the icon could change to indicate this. but having two notifications in this case wouldn't make sense, i agree...
hi again, it would also be nice if convorsation would show which users are currently online in a given group
@g0ph3r it shows the online users by display a green dot on the user image
notifications will be completely rewritten
@EisFrei Another thing I just noticed regarding notifications: New message notifications do not disappear when I do NOT click on the notification but switch back to the app instead.

@EisFrei Yeah, I also noticed the green dot now. But this only works if everybody replied recently. I'd like to enter a group and would like to check if anybody is online. This is quite hard to achieve right now... ;)
it has nothing to do with recent posts. the last version introduced a bug (tadah) so you need to go to the main screen a second time. after that the online status will be displayed correctly
correct
@EisFrei Ok, but AFAIK there is no way to display a single list of everyone currently online in a group. Or did I misunderstand your last reply?
